1: Later, the Lord told Moses and Aaron,
2: “Every single Israeli[a] is to encamp beneath his standard with the emblem of his ancestral house. The Israelis are to encamp in front of and surrounding the Tent of Meeting.”
3: “The encampment of Judah is to settle east toward the sunrise[b] under their standard. The leader of Judah is to be Amminadab's son Nahshon.
5: “The tribe of Issachar is to encamp beside Judah.[d] The leader of Issachar is to be Zuar's son Nethanel.
7: “Next is to be[f] the tribe of Zebulun. The leader of Zebulun is to be Helon's son Eliab.
9: All those numbered by division in the camp of Judah total 186,400. They are to be the first to travel.”
10: “Toward the south is to be the division of the camp of Reuben under their standard. The leader of Reuben is to be Shedeur's son Elizur.
12: “The tribe of Simeon is to camp beside Reuben.[g] The leader of Simeon is to be Zurishaddai's son Shelumiel.
14: “Next is to be[h] the tribe of Gad. The leader of Gad is to be Deuel's son Eliasaph.
16: All those numbered by division in the camp of Reuben total 151,450. They are to be the second to travel.”
17: “Then the Tent of Meeting is to travel with the camp of the descendants of Levi in the middle of the camps. They are to travel just as they have camped, each as designated[i] under his standard.”
18: “Toward the west[j] is to be the division of the camp of Ephraim under their standard. The leader of Ephraim is to be Ammihud's son Elishama.
20: “The tribe of Manasseh is to encamp beside them.[k] The leader of Manasseh is to be Pedahzur's son Gamaliel.
22: “Next is to be[l] the tribe of Benjamin. The leader of Benjamin is to be Gideoni's son Abidan.
24: All those numbered by division in the camp Ephraim total 108,100. They are to be the third to travel.”
25: “Toward the north is to be the division of the camp of Dan under their standard. The leader of Dan is to be Ammishaddai's son Ahiezer.
27: “The tribe of Asher is to encamp beside them.[m] The leader of Asher is to be Ochran's son Pagiel.
29: “Next is to be[n] the tribe of Naphtali. The leader of Naphtali is to be Enan's son Ahira.
31: All those numbered by division in the camp of Dan total 157,600. They are to be the last to travel under their standards.”
32: Here is a summary of the census of the Israelis according to the tribes of their ancestral houses: All the divisions in the camps numbered 603,550,
33: but the descendants of Levi were not numbered along with the other Israelis, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
34: So the Israelis did everything just as the Lord had commanded Moses; that is, they encamped under their standard as each person traveled with his own tribe and ancestral house.
